#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with NDP candidate Glenn Crowe , Bramalea-Gore-Malton
#Text=Thursday , October 4 , 2007
#Text=Glenn Crowe is running for the NDP in the Ontario provincial election , in the Bramalea-Gore-Malton riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Crowe did not reply to various questions asked .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I believe that it 's time working families got both a fair deal and increased representation in Queen ’s Park .
#Text=I live and grew up in the riding of Bramalea Gore Malton .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=I believe that the three most important issues are :
#Text=The $10/hr living wage
#Text=The availability of good paying jobs
#Text=Making life affordable
#Text=To address the issues :
#Text=Pass the living wage act NOW .
#Text=If the MPP ’s can vote themselves a 31 % pay raise , why ca n’t we have a living wage today ?
#Text=In exchange for job creation & preservation guarantees , provide manufacturing and resource companies with a stable hydro rate .
#Text=Beef up existing employment standards to ensure that companies are discouraged from buying businesses just to close them down .
#Text=When a closure ca n’t be avoided improve both the severance pay and increase the notice to reflect the job market of today .
#Text=We need to ensure that the provincial government uses it influence to make sure that consumers get a fair deal from their auto insurance companies , banks , payroll loans and oil companies .
#Text=Since for working families these expenses can make the difference living in or out of poverty .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Pass the living wage act , followed by auto insurance reform and increasing the services available to developmentally delayed adults .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=I believe that property taxes are too high and unfairly target people on fixed incomes who can least afford the increases .
#Text=One of the main reasons that they are high is due to provincial downloading .
#Text=The NDP plans to upload a number of provincially mandated services starting with public transit and court security first in January 2008 .
#Text=Followed by Ontario Disability Support Program and the Ontario Drug Benefit Program by 2011 .
#Text=We would be on track to upload the download that was imposed on property tax payers by the Mike Harris conservative government by 2015 .
#Text=This would free up money that the cities can then use to either fund or enhance the services that they offer to their citizens .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?

#Text=Since hydro can be one of a company ’s largest costs , our industrial hydro rate will give resource and manufacturing industries access to low cost hydro to ensure that our rates do not cause a company to move out of the province .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I believe that the majority threshold has been set to high it should be 50 % + 1 not 60 % .
#Text=Part of our platform on electoral reform would be the limiting of political contributions to individuals only .
#Text=This would prevent large corporations from making huge donations and giving that political party an unfair advantage when it comes to getting their message out to the voters .
#Text=What role , if any , does " new media " play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=I believe that the “ new media ” provides an excellent source of information on both the candidate as well as the political party that they representing .
#Text=For those who are internet savy a web site is the quickest method of getting this information .
#Text=The challenge is to keep the information on the web site relevant as well as finding the time to update it .
#Text=It ’s a great benefit to someone who may not be able to meet the candidate face to face .
